TopicTitle: What did you name your first rocket?

Articles.Content: My first rocket in career mod was named "First I"
My first rockets were called Hermii 1 to 14 for narrow bodied manned flights. Unmanned probes were called Sunarii 1 & 2 and the large body manned version is known as Hermii II flight 1 etc.

Magic.

Which considering I have been playing since 17.0, there has been a lot of Magic I, II, III and so on.

Lost in space

alacrity

Please don't "sign" your post; that's what signatures are for.

I think my first rocket was called the... um... well, I think it was a Scott Manley design, anyway.

The Mark I

It isn't good to get to attached to something that will obviously be shortlived...

My first series of rockets was the Ananke series. Took the place of a Mercury program. Ananke is the goddess of inevitability, compulsion, and necessity. I thought it was a pretty fitting name for the first stage of my program.
My first rocket name was Orbiter 1, as I was trying to get into orbit. It worked well, but ever since the save-breaking update of .21 I forgot how to build it!

MinMun Lander Science MKI

I tend to regularly redesign rockets and I like knowing what my previous designs were in case of catastrophic issues. I'd quickly forget what each rocket was for if I used more creative names.

"Disaster Transport I"

It lived up to its name almost immediately.

Back in 0.17, I believe the name of my first rocket was "Orbiter mk1".

I know. Pretty exciting.

My first rocket name was Orbiter 1, as I was trying to get into orbit. It worked well, but ever since the save-breaking update of .21 I forgot how to build it!

Hey, you stole my totally original idea >:C

Kerbal I

I'm such a creative little guy

Moho I

Mercury, Moho, Mercury, Moho, Mercury Moho...

You get it by now.

Spica

Moho I

Mercury, Moho, Mercury, Moho, Mercury Moho...

You get it by now.

Spica

My first rocket was "Kraken" very succesful transporter.

Brody_Peffley
I believe mine was the Skyforger I, made in the demo and named for an Amorphis album. My first orbiter was the Sampo V.
My first rocket didn't have a name, but when I bought the game the first rocket I built in it was called Explorer I.

gonna die1

as compared with my first plane

suicide mark1

Ironically I haven't yet lost a kerbal...

I called mine Moho 7.

Seven guesses why...
Upper Goer I
Simply I just called it Crash.

Skip Mk 1.

The idea of the namings of my rockets was to give them a variation of the verb "jump".

So the first one was skip, 2nd one was hop, 3rd was jump, etc. and the last and biggest being Leap.
In 0.13, the Angel Mk. 1. I still have the Angel Mk. VII somewhere.
Auto-Saved Craft
Don't know what I named my rockets (or if I ever named them) in the demo, but my first rocket in 0.20 was called "Onion Stick Mk. 01" (the actual .craft was called KERTSUNE, after the payload)

Untitled Space Craft

I think probably my first 50 rockets were named this until I realized I could / how to rename them, even then I don't think I started to rename them until I came up with a design I actually wanted to save and then started to name them "Lincoln Mark #" series. But it's time to rename them but I've not come up with a new name just yet.
Hermes I, first in the 4 part Hermes Program to gather science on Kerbin and in LKO.
